course.title: WORDLY WISE 3000 & Grammar
course.overviewText: This course builds critical literacy skills by strengthening reading comprehension, vocabulary, grammar, and written expression. Students learn to analyze texts, organize ideas, and communicate clearly through structured writing tasks, supporting their growth across all subject areas.

teacher.name: Mr. Stephen Ni
teacher.description: Founder of Vanlearn International Education, with 20 years of university English teaching experience. An IELTS/TOEFL all-subject instructor holding a CERTESL (Certificate in Teaching English as a Second Language). Previously served as a lead reading and writing instructor at well-known training institutions such as New Oriental and Longre. Specializes in teaching and research in Adult ESL, Children’s ELL, and English Reading and Writing courses. Advocates a student-centered teaching philosophy that emphasizes the teacher’s role as a facilitator.

course.title: Chinese Language Course
course.overviewText: Language courses are designed to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing abilities in Chinese, French, and Japanese. Emphasis is placed on both linguistic proficiency and cultural literacy, helping students become confident communicators and global citizens.

teacher.name: Mr. Bai Jingbo
teacher.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teacher.description: As a respected Chinese instructor in Canada, Bai Jingbo brings a rich background in media and writing to his teaching. His diverse experience—from university lecturing and journalism at CCTV to professional scriptwriting—has honed his deep expertise in Chinese language and literature. In the classroom, he leverages this unique perspective to help students appreciate linguistic nuances and cultural depth, fostering a learning environment that is both intellectually stimulating and culturally enriching.

course.title: Mathematics Tutoring
course.overviewText: Mathematics courses are designed to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing abilities in Chinese, French, and Japanese. Emphasis is placed on both linguistic proficiency and cultural literacy, helping students become confident communicators and global citizens.

teacher.name: Mr. Mike
teacher.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
teacher.description: Mr. Mike specializes in using real-life examples to explain abstract concepts. He emphasizes personalized teaching and builds students’ confidence through interactive “error analysis” sessions. From illustrating functions with animations to creating fractal art in Python and designing “Geek Challenge” courses, he makes learning both engaging and inspiring. He once guided students to solve the classic “Chickens and Rabbits in the Same Cage” problem through coding—making knowledge both fun and meaningful.

course.title: Piano & Guzheng
course.overviewText: Students receive professional training in music performance and theory, building technical skill, musical expression, and discipline. Playing instruments such as the guzheng and piano not only enhances fine motor coordination but also fosters emotional expression and cultural appreciation.

teacher.name: Ms. Vivian Wang
teacher.description: She graduated from Minzu University of China and Renmin University of China, majoring in piano performance and pedagogy. She has been teaching piano for 18 years and has served as a judge and examiner for piano competitions in China for many years. Her teaching philosophy is individualized, tailoring lesson plans to each student's unique characteristics and needs. She hopes that under her guidance, every student will find their own joy and sense of accomplishment in the world of music.

course.title: Creative Art
course.overviewText: Through exploration of the visual and performing arts, students cultivate artistic literacy and creative self-expression. The program encourages imagination, critical thinking, and appreciation for diverse artistic traditions, supporting both personal growth and cultural understanding.

teacher.name: Ms. Bi Yu
teacher.education: Graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts, Liaoning Normal University
description: Graduated from Shandong University of Art & Design with a major in Modeling Arts. In 2022, she completed watercolor and oil painting courses at AUArts . Member of the Alberta Society of Artists.

She has been working in art education since 2011 and has extensive teaching experience. Passionate about painting, she patiently guides her students, many of whom have won awards in North American and Canadian art competitions. She has also been recognized multiple times as an outstanding art instructor
